name: source/index.js
Collisions
description: A collision system used to track bodies in order to improve collision detection performance

name: createCircle
description: Creates a {@link Circle} and inserts it into the collision system

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: createPolygon
description: Creates a {@link Polygon} and inserts it into the collision system

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: points
params.description: An array of coordinate pairs making up the polygon - [[x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...]

params.name: angle
params.description: The starting rotation in radians

params.name: scale_x
params.description: The starting scale along the X axis

params.name: scale_y
params.description: The starting scale long the Y axis

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: createPoint
description: Creates a {@link Point} and inserts it into the collision system

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: createResult
description: Creates a {@link Result} used to collect the detailed results of a collision test

name: createResult
description: Creates a Result used to collect the detailed results of a collision test

name: insert
description: Inserts bodies into the collision system

name: remove
description: Removes bodies = require(the collision system

name: update
description: Updates the collision system. This should be called before any collisions are tested.

name: draw
description: Draws the bodies within the system to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path

params.name: context
params.description: The context to draw to

name: drawBVH
description: Draws the system's BVH to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path. This is useful for testing out different padding values for bodies.

params.name: context
params.description: The context to draw to

name: potentials
description: Returns a list of potential collisions for a body

params.name: body
params.description: The body to test for potential collisions against

name: collides
description: Determines if two bodies are colliding

params.name: target
params.description: The target body to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

params.name: aabb
params.description: Set to false to skip the AABB test (useful if you use your own potential collision heuristic)

name: source/modules/BVH.js
BVH
description: A Bounding Volume Hierarchy (BVH) used to find potential collisions quickly

name: insert
description: Inserts a body into the BVH

params.name: body
params.description: The body to insert

params.name: updating
params.description: Set to true if the body already exists in the BVH (used internally when updating the body's position)

name: remove
description: Removes a body from the BVH

params.name: body
params.description: The body to remove

params.name: updating
params.description: Set to true if this is a temporary removal (used internally when updating the body's position)

name: update
description: Updates the BVH. Moved bodies are removed/inserted.

name: potentials
description: Returns a list of potential collisions for a body

params.name: body
params.description: The body to test

name: draw
description: Draws the bodies within the BVH to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path

params.name: context
params.description: The context to draw to

name: drawBVH
description: Draws the BVH to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path. This is useful for testing out different padding values for bodies.

params.name: context
params.description: The context to draw to

name: source/modules/BVHBranch.js
BVHBranch
description: A branch within a BVH

name: getBranch
description: Returns a branch from the branch pool or creates a new branch

name: releaseBranch
description: Releases a branch back into the branch pool

params.name: branch
params.description: The branch to release

name: sortBranches
description: Sorting callback used to sort branches by deepest first

params.name: a
params.description: The first branch

params.name: b
params.description: The second branch

name: source/modules/Body.js
Body
description: The base class for bodies used to detect collisions

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: x
description: The X coordinate of the body

name: y
description: The Y coordinate of the body

name: padding
description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: collides
description: Determines if the body is colliding with another body

params.name: target
params.description: The target body to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

params.name: aabb
params.description: Set to false to skip the AABB test (useful if you use your own potential collision heuristic)

name: potentials
description: Returns a list of potential collisions

name: remove
description: Removes the body from its current collision system

name: createResult
description: Creates a {@link Result} used to collect the detailed results of a collision test

name: createResult
description: Creates a Result used to collect the detailed results of a collision test

name: source/modules/Circle.js
Circle
description: A circle used to detect collisions

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: radius
params.description: The radius

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: draw
description: Draws the circle to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path

params.name: context
params.description: The context to add the arc to

name: source/modules/Point.js
Point
description: A point used to detect collisions

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: source/modules/Polygon.js
Polygon
description: A polygon used to detect collisions

params.name: x
params.description: The starting X coordinate

params.name: y
params.description: The starting Y coordinate

params.name: points
params.description: An array of coordinate pairs making up the polygon - [[x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...]

params.name: angle
params.description: The starting rotation in radians

params.name: scale_x
params.description: The starting scale along the X axis

params.name: scale_y
params.description: The starting scale long the Y axis

params.name: padding
params.description: The amount to pad the bounding volume when testing for potential collisions

name: angle
description: The angle of the body in radians

name: scale_x
description: The scale of the body along the X axis

name: scale_y
description: The scale of the body along the Y axis

name: draw
description: Draws the polygon to a CanvasRenderingContext2D's current path

params.name: context
params.description: The context to add the shape to

name: setPoints
description: Sets the points making up the polygon. It's important to use this function when changing the polygon's shape to ensure internal data is also updated.

params.name: new_points
params.description: An array of coordinate pairs making up the polygon - [[x1, y1], [x2, y2], ...]

name: _calculateCoords
description: Calculates and caches the polygon's world coordinates based on its points, angle, and scale

name: _calculateNormals
description: Calculates the normals and edges of the polygon's sides

name: source/modules/Result.js
Result
description:
An object used to collect the detailed results of a collision test

> **Note:** It is highly recommended you recycle the same Result object if possible in order to avoid wasting memory

name: collision
description: True if a collision was detected

name: a
description: The source body tested

name: b
description: The target body tested against

name: a_in_b
description: True if A is completely contained within B

name: b_in_a
description: True if B is completely contained within A

name: overlap
description: The magnitude of the shortest axis of overlap

name: overlap_x
description: The X direction of the shortest axis of overlap

name: overlap_y
description: The Y direction of the shortest axis of overlap

name: source/modules/SAT.js
SAT
description: Determines if two bodies are colliding using the Separating Axis Theorem

params.name: a
params.description: The source body to test

params.name: b
params.description: The target body to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

params.name: aabb
params.description: Set to false to skip the AABB test (useful if you use your own collision heuristic)

name: aabbAABB
description: Determines if two bodies' axis aligned bounding boxes are colliding

params.name: a
params.description: The source body to test

params.name: b
params.description: The target body to test against

name: polygonPolygon
description: Determines if two polygons are colliding

params.name: a
params.description: The source polygon to test

params.name: b
params.description: The target polygon to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

name: polygonCircle
description: Determines if a polygon and a circle are colliding

params.name: a
params.description: The source polygon to test

params.name: b
params.description: The target circle to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

params.name: reverse
params.description: Set to true to reverse a and b in the result parameter when testing circle->polygon instead of polygon->circle

name: circleCircle
description: Determines if two circles are colliding

params.name: a
params.description: The source circle to test

params.name: b
params.description: The target circle to test against

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

name: separatingAxis
description: Determines if two polygons are separated by an axis

params.name: a_coords
params.description: The coordinates of the polygon to test

params.name: b_coords
params.description: The coordinates of the polygon to test against

params.name: x
params.description: The X direction of the axis

params.name: y
params.description: The Y direction of the axis

params.name: result
params.description: A Result object on which to store information about the collision

name: source/modules/index.js
./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "detect-collisions",
  "types": "collisions.d.ts",
  "version": "2.5.0",
  "description": "zero-dependency 2d collision detection for circles, polygons, and points (with SAT and BVH)",
  "main": "source/index.js",
  "scripts": {
    "docs:make": "jsdoc --configure .jsdoc.json --verbose",
    "docs:copy": "rm -rf docs/ && mkdir docs && mv out/detect-collisions/*/* docs/ && git add docs/",
    "docs": "yarn docs:make && yarn docs:copy",
    "docs:dev": "yarn docs && http-server docs",
    "lint": "eslint ./source --fix",
    "demo": "yarn webpack && cp demo/index.html docs/demo && http-server docs/demo",
    "compile": "babel ./source --out-dir ./es2015",
    "build": "rm -rf ./docs/* && esdoc && webpack"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/Prozi/detect-collisions.git"
  },
  "keywords": [
    "Collision",
    "Separating Axis Theorem",
    "Bounding Volume Hierarchy",
    "SAT",
    "BVH",
    "Circle",
    "Polygon",
    "Line",
    "Shape",
    "Separating",
    "Axis",
    "Theorem",
    "Bounding",
    "Volume",
    "Hierarchy"
  ],
  "author": "Samuel Hodge",
  "license": "MIT",
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/Prozi/detect-collisions/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/Prozi/detect-collisions#readme",
  "devDependencies": {
    "babel-cli": "^6.26.0",
    "babel-loader": "^8.1.0",
    "babel-preset-es2015": "^6.24.1",
    "chalk": "^3.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "html-webpack-plugin": "^4.0.2",
    "http-server": "^0.12.1",
    "jsdoc": "^3.6.3",
    "webpack": "^4.42.1",
    "webpack-command": "^0.5.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "jsdoc-template": "https://github.com/braintree/jsdoc-template.git",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.3.11"
  },
  "dependencies": {},
  "editions": [
    {
      "description": "Source + ESNext + Import",
      "entry": "index.js",
      "directory": "source",
      "syntaxes": [
        "javascript",
        "esnext",
        "require",
        "arrows",
        "getset",
        "const",
        "let",
        "classes",
        "defaults",
        "spread",
        "rest",
        "destructuring",
        "template strings"
      ]
    },
    {
      "description": "Compiled + ES2015 + Require",
      "entry": "index.js",
      "directory": "es2015",
      "syntaxes": [
        "javascript",
        "es2015",
        "require"
      ]
    }
  ]
}
name: package.json
